result.execSummary:
The defendant Cj A. Greyhair was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Cj A. Greyhair
parties.address: P O Box 1145, Black River Falls, WI 54615

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any other probation now serving

miscConds.notes: Must pay the court costs and supervision costs.  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  No DNA surcharge ordered.
Must seek and maintain full-time employment satisfactory to your probation agent.  You must not leave or change employment without prior approval of your probation agent.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants except for employment purposes only with the Ho-Chunk Nation.  Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Must not associate with any know drug users or dealers nor be present where illegal drugs are used or sold.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  1 day sentence credit is ordered.
Defendant may apply for expungement if probation successfully completed and all court obligations are satisfied.

supervisions.notes: A civil judgment has been entered against you for the unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cj A. Greyhair

defendant.name: Greyhair, Cj A.
defendant.address: P O Box 1145, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Payment Plan Request.  Granted $50.00/month beginning 4-15-2016.  LAM

Defendant appeared in custody with counsel Robet Gardner.  Gerald Fox appeared for the State. There are no corrections noted in the revocation summary.  Joint recommendation for sentencing.  Both counsel stipulate to 164 days sentence credit.  Judge reviewed charges and potential penalites on 12CM310 & 14CF198.  Court orders:  12CM310 - 4 1/2 months jail concurrent to 14CF190 with credit for 164 days;  14CF198 - 9 months jail with credit for 164 days.  Civil judgments ordered on both cases for unpaid financial obligations.  13CF60 will be resolved with the new case, 15CM220.
from DOC
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 01-28-2016 03:15 pm
Destroyed fingerprint card

Defendant appeared with counsel Robert Gardner.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  DA motioned the Court to amend Count 1 in 14CF198 to 946.09(1)(a) - Misd. Bailjumping.  Court granted the motion.  DA has complied with victim notification requirements.  No victims are present.  Amended Information filed in 13CF60.  Waived the reading of such.  Statement as to Negotiated Plea and Diversion Agreement filed.  Defendant pled to the following:  12CM310 - Guilty to Count 1; 13CF60 - Counts 1 & 2 No Contest and Counts 3 & 4 Guilty; 14CF198 - Guilty to amended Count 1.  Defendant waived right to restitution hearing.  Court reviews plea questionnaire/waiver of rights/elements with defendant and was given felony warning.  Defense stips to facts in complaint presented at preliminary hearing.  Court finds waiver of rights done freely, voluntarily, intelligently made.  Accepts plea on all except Count 1 of 13CF60 but did accept the DPA on that count.  Sentence withheld and placed on probation for 3 years with the conditions listed in the Statement of Negotiated Plea.  Given 1 day sentence credit in 14CF198 and 2 days sentence credit in 12CM310.  Defendant is to report to Probation by 10:00 tomorrow (1-30-15).
Statement as to Negotiated Plea and Diversion Agreement

Pre-trial conference at 02-04-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 02-23-2015 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Garnder.  Reading of complaint waived.

Bond includes cases 13CF60 and 14CF198:  Report for booking.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request. Curfew from 9:00 p.m. to 6:00 a.m.. Must reside at N7652 Mitchell Redcloud Memorial Road Black River Falls WI.
DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared without counsel.  Warrant quashed.
appeared w/o counsel
Adjourned initial appearance on January 12, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Attorney Robert Gardner called.  He will have the defendant appear at 1:00 today to quash the warrant authorized yesterday.  We are to add him as attorney of record.
No appearance made by defendant.  DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.
Initial appearance on December 15, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Emailed Attorney Gardner to have his client come in to sign a corrected bond.  The amount was wrong on the one he signed yesterday.
